titleStmt.title: A strange but true narrative of the delusion of the devil at a late Quakers meeting, on one John Thurston. How he was seduced to turn Quaker, and possessed by an evil spirit and of a tempation he had to cut his own throat, and how he was preserved therefrom and several passages which happen'd to him in the time of his delusion / attested to by Mr. William Robinson.
titleStmt.author: Robinson, William, fl. 1678.

titleStmt.title: A strange but true narrative of the delusion of the devil at a late Quakers meeting, on one John Thurston. How he was seduced to turn Quaker, and possessed by an evil spirit and of a tempation he had to cut his own throat, and how he was preserved therefrom and several passages which happen'd to him in the time of his delusion / attested to by Mr. William Robinson.
titleStmt.author: Robinson, William, fl. 1678.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.

person.persName: Thurston, John, of Kendal in Westmoreland
